TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListView/SelectedListViewItemCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList
type ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection = class interface IList interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents the collection of selected items in a list view control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> stores the selected items in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. The items stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> are items contained in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores all items displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
The following table shows an example of how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores the items of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> as well as their selection states in an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
|Index|Item|Selection state in the ListView| |-----------|----------|-------------------------------------| |0|Item1|Unselected| |1|Item2|Selected| |2|Item3|Unselected| |3|Item4|Selected| |4|Item5|Selected|
Based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> example in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> would appear.
|Index|Selected item in the ListViewItemCollection| |-----------|-------------------------------------------------| |0|Item2| |1|Item4| |2|Item5|
You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> class is a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>. Once you know that the item is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedItems%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexChanged> event, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.HeaderStyle%2A> members and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection> class. To run this example, paste the following code in a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> object named `ListView1` and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> named `TextBox1`. Call the `InitializeListView` method from the form's constructor or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event handler. This example requires that the event handler is correctly associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexChanged> event
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/VB/form1.vb#1)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/CPP/form1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/CS/form1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView1#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView1/VB/form1.vb#2)]

Docs.param: The control that owns the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

Docs.summary: Removes all items from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method enables you to clear all selections from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem item) cil managed
Public Function Contains (item As ListViewItem) As Boolean

Docs.param: A representing the item to locate in the collection.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.
Docs.returns: if the specified item is located in the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> class is one of the selected items stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>. Once you know that the item is in the selected item collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ContainsKey(string key) cil managed
Public Overridable Function ContainsKey (key As String) As Boolean
abstract member ContainsKey : string -> bool override this.ContainsKey : string -> bool

Docs.param: The name of the item to find in the collection.
Docs.summary: Determines whether an item with the specified key is contained in the collection.
Docs.returns: to indicate the specified item is contained in the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.ContainsKey%2A> returns `false`.

Docs.param: An representing the array to copy the contents of the collection to.
The location within the destination array to copy the items from the collection to.
Docs.summary: Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this method to combine the selected items from multiple collections into a single array.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of items in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property enables you to determine the number of selected items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control. You can then use this value when looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop. Unless the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.MultiSelect%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is set to `true`, this property always returns a value of zero (0) or one (1) depending on whether you have a selected item.

Docs.returns: An that represents the collection of selected items.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem item) cil managed
Public Function IndexOf (item As ListViewItem) As Integer

Docs.param: A representing the item to locate in the collection.
Docs.summary: Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index of the item in the collection. If the item is not located in the collection, the return value is negative one (-1).

remarks.format: ## Remarks Once you know that an item is in the selected item collection (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method), you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 IndexOfKey(string key) cil managed
Public Overridable Function IndexOfKey (key As String) As Integer
abstract member IndexOfKey : string -> int override this.IndexOfKey : string -> int

Docs.param: The name of the item to find in the collection.
Docs.summary: Returns the index of the first occurrence of the item with the specified key.
Docs.returns: The zero-based index of the first item with the specified key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive. If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean
public: property bool IsReadOnly { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
Docs.value: if the collection is read-only; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is always `true` for this collection. The items in the collection can only be modified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

Docs.summary: Gets an item from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This indexer enables you to get a specific item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedListViewItemCollection>. The item stored in the collection is an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that represents a selected item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.

Docs.exception: The parameter is less than zero or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
